short_description: This function predicts input data based on XGBoost_Drive function.
long_description: This function predicts input data based on XGBoost_Drive function.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the input test data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the input test data.

input_tables.name: ModelTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table containing the model data.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table containing the model data.

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set
argument_clauses.description: Specifies a column containing a unique identifier for each test point in the test set

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: AttributeNameColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Required for sparse data format, if the data set is in sparse format, this argument indicates the column containing the attributes in the input table
argument_clauses.description: Required for sparse data format, if the data set is in sparse format, this argument indicates the column containing the attributes in the input table

argument_clauses.name: AttributeValueColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: If the data is in the sparse format, this argument indicates the column containing the attribute values in the input table
argument_clauses.description: If the data is in the sparse format, this argument indicates the column containing the attribute values in the input table

argument_clauses.name: IterNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of iterations for each boosted tree to use for prediction. The number must an INTEGER. The lower bound is 1. If this argument is not specified, the value is the same as used for training model. The number of iterations used is upperbounded by the number of iterations used during training.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of iterations for each boosted tree to use for prediction. The number must an INTEGER. The lower bound is 1. If this argument is not specified, the value is the same as used for training model. The number of iterations used is upperbounded by the number of iterations used during training.

argument_clauses.name: NumBoostedTrees
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of boosted trees to be used for prediction. If this argument is not specified, the value is the same as used for training model. The number of boosted trees used for prediciton is upper bounded by the number of boosted trees used during training.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the number of boosted trees to be used for prediction. If this argument is not specified, the value is the same as used for training model. The number of boosted trees used for prediciton is upper bounded by the number of boosted trees used during training.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
